customer_reviews.title: Anti-Chaffing Solution from Now On
customer_reviews.text: I've been a user of BodyGlide, but I don't like the fact that it melts into a mess when left in high heat. Ruby's Lube works. I like the fact that it has simple ingredients and is a USA product. There's some fragrance, but it isn't highly perfumed. I also like that it can be also be used for massage. On hot days, it does become runny, but I've found that shaking and pouring/running cool water over the tube resolve this issue. I'll be using this as my anti-chaffing solution from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Mister.MurphyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used so far!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING! I've used several different brands of anti-chaffing products and this one is by far my favorite. It's thick enough to stay put during exercise, and doesn't run off with sweat...but it washes off quickly and completely in the shower. It's got all natural ingredients, so I don't need to worry about excess artificial or dangerous chemicals leeching into my body. It smells great, too...not like chemicals and the lemongrass smell isn't overpowering at all. It just smells very fresh and clean.

customer_reviews.title: Good for skin, but not so good as a chamois cream
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a high quality moisturizer/lube and is really nice on the skin. It had decent reviews, so I thought it'd be worth a try but I won't get it again. The consistency lets it just get absorbed into the chamois too easily to be useful on all day bike adventures. The ingredients are soothing and definitely make your skin soft, but it's not durable enough to be used exclusively as a chamois cream. I'll probably get the tried and true Assos cream everybody else uses next time.

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff out there!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many chafing creams over the years of cycling/running and they all have left me wishing they would hang around more. They all seem to need reapplying after about an hour. Not the case with Ruby's Lube. Even after applying it during a triathlon, before the swim, I come out of the water, get on the bike and don't have to reapply Ruby's Lube. Nipple chafing for you guys? Not an issue if you put a little dab on before your next long run. Thigh chafing for us bigger buys? Not anymore. I love this stuff! As an added bonus, it's all natural and it smells really nice too.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Rusk

customer_reviews.title: Smells Bad
customer_reviews.text: I can’t stand the smell. I’m sure it’s a great product but I will be throwing it in the trash due to the odor.
customer_reviews.author: kbelle

customer_reviews.title: It Ain't Ride Glide, Alas!
customer_reviews.text: It does smell good. I'm glad to have the little travel size and I'll see how that works on my lips. I wanted to like this product but for me, as a cyclist it does not go on easily and smoothly. It's thick, more like Vaseline. It didn't really help that much with chafing, sad to say. It's just not Hoo-Ha Ride Glide ,which for my money is the best stuff out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Who Sings

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a product by Monistat that is great for preventing pudgy thighs from sticking together when wearing a skirt. I needed a replacement and in a hurry before a trip, so I ordered this product. It is not similar and does not meet my needs. Rather than allowing body parts to glide past each other, this product is sticky and feels almost like rubbing vaseline on my thighs. It has the opposite effect of what I was looking for. It may be a great product for athletic uses, but ladies, if you want to wear a skirt in warm weather without thigh issues, this is not what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Uyemura
